title: What’s News: Business & Finance
body:
Facebook and Alphabet’s Google agreed to “cooperate and assist one another” if they ever faced an investigation into their pact to work together in online advertising, according to an unredacted version of a lawsuit filed by 10 states against Google.
MGM Holdings is exploring a sale, betting that its library of content will prove attractive to companies pursuing growth in streaming video.
Tesla shares fell 6.5% in their S&P 500 debut, as the wave of demand that had propelled the stock ahead of its inclusion subsided.
Congress passed tighter rules for approving jetliner designs as part of an omnibus spending bill, mandating safety reforms sparked by two Boeing 737 MAX crashes.
Shell said it would write down the value of its assets by up to $4.5 billion and warned of another set of poor earnings for the fourth quarter.
